     798           0 : static int mov_read_dac3(MOVContext *c, AVIOContext *pb, MOVAtom atom)

     832           0 : static int mov_read_dec3(MOVContext *c, AVIOContext *pb, MOVAtom atom)
     833             : {
     834           0 :     AVStream *st;
     835           0 :     enum AVAudioServiceType *ast;
     836           0 :     int eac3info, acmod, lfeon, bsmod;
     837           0 :     uint64_t mask;
     838             : 
     839           0 :     if (c->fc->nb_streams < 1)
     840             :         return 0;
     841           0 :     st = c->fc->streams[c->fc->nb_streams-1];
     842             : 
     843           0 :     ast = (enum AVAudioServiceType*)av_stream_new_side_data(st, AV_PKT_DATA_AUDIO_SERVICE_TYPE,
     844             :                                                             sizeof(*ast));
     845           0 :     if (!ast)
     846             :         return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
     847             : 
     848             :     /* No need to parse fields for additional independent substreams and its
     849             :      * associated dependent substreams since libavcodec's E-AC-3 decoder
     850             :      * does not support them yet. */
     851           0 :     avio_rb16(pb); /* data_rate and num_ind_sub */
     852           0 :     eac3info = avio_rb24(pb);
     853           0 :     bsmod = (eac3info >> 12) & 0x1f;
     854           0 :     acmod = (eac3info >>  9) & 0x7;

    1299           0 : static int search_frag_timestamp(MOVFragmentIndex *frag_index,
    1300             :                                  AVStream *st, int64_t timestamp)
    1301             : {

    1303           0 :     int64_t frag_time;

    1307             :         // If the stream is referenced by any sidx, limit the search
    1308             :         // to fragments that referenced this stream in the sidx
    1309           0 :         MOVStreamContext *sc = st->priv_data;

    1311           0 :             id = st->id;

    1321           0 :                (frag_time = get_frag_time(frag_index, m, id)) == AV_NOPTS_VALUE)

    1714             : /* Read a whole atom into the extradata return the size of the atom read, possibly truncated if != atom.size */
    1715           0 : static int64_t mov_read_atom_into_extradata(MOVContext *c, AVIOContext *pb, MOVAtom atom,
    1716             :                                         AVCodecParameters *par, uint8_t *buf)
    1717             : {
    1718           0 :     int64_t result = atom.size;
    1719           0 :     int err;
    1720             : 
    1721           0 :     AV_WB32(buf    , atom.size + 8);
    1722           0 :     AV_WL32(buf + 4, atom.type);
    1723           0 :     err = ffio_read_size(pb, buf + 8, atom.size);
    1724           0 :     if (err < 0) {
    1725           0 :         par->extradata_size -= atom.size;
    1726           0 :         return err;
    1727           0 :     } else if (err < atom.size) {
    1728           0 :         av_log(c->fc, AV_LOG_WARNING, "truncated extradata\n");
    1729           0 :         par->extradata_size -= atom.size - err;
    1730           0 :         result = err;
    1731             :     }
    1732           0 :     memset(buf + 8 + err, 0, AV_INPUT_BUFFER_PADDING_SIZE);
    1733           0 :     return result;
    1734             : }
    1735             : 
    1736             : /* FIXME modify QDM2/SVQ3/H.264 decoders to take full atom as extradata */
    1737           0 : static int mov_read_extradata(MOVContext *c, AVIOContext *pb, MOVAtom atom,
    1738             :                               enum AVCodecID codec_id)
    1739             : {
    1740           0 :     AVStream *st;
    1741           0 :     uint64_t original_size;
    1742           0 :     int err;
    1743             : 
    1744           0 :     if (c->fc->nb_streams < 1) // will happen with jp2 files
    1745             :         return 0;
    1746           0 :     st = c->fc->streams[c->fc->nb_streams-1];
    1747             : 
    1748           0 :     if (st->codecpar->codec_id != codec_id)
    1749             :         return 0; /* unexpected codec_id - don't mess with extradata */
    1750             : 
    1751           0 :     original_size = st->codecpar->extradata_size;
    1752           0 :     err = mov_realloc_extradata(st->codecpar, atom);
    1753           0 :     if (err)
    1754             :         return err;
    1755             : 
    1756           0 :     err =  mov_read_atom_into_extradata(c, pb, atom, st->codecpar,  st->codecpar->extradata + original_size);
    1757           0 :     if (err < 0)
    1758             :         return err;
    1759             :     return 0; // Note: this is the original behavior to ignore truncation.

    2134           0 : static void mov_parse_stsd_video(MOVContext *c, AVIOContext *pb,
    2135             :                                  AVStream *st, MOVStreamContext *sc)
    2136             : {
    2137           0 :     uint8_t codec_name[32] = { 0 };
    2138           0 :     int64_t stsd_start;
    2139           0 :     unsigned int len;
    2140           0 :     uint32_t id = 0;
    2141             : 
    2142             :     /* The first 16 bytes of the video sample description are already
    2143             :      * read in ff_mov_read_stsd_entries() */
    2144           0 :     stsd_start = avio_tell(pb) - 16;
    2145             : 
    2146           0 :     avio_rb16(pb); /* version */
    2147           0 :     avio_rb16(pb); /* revision level */
    2148           0 :     id = avio_rl32(pb); /* vendor */
    2149           0 :     av_dict_set(&st->metadata, "vendor_id", av_fourcc2str(id), 0);
    2150           0 :     avio_rb32(pb); /* temporal quality */
    2151           0 :     avio_rb32(pb); /* spatial quality */
    2152             : 
    2153           0 :     st->codecpar->width  = avio_rb16(pb); /* width */
    2154           0 :     st->codecpar->height = avio_rb16(pb); /* height */
    2155             : 
    2156           0 :     avio_rb32(pb); /* horiz resolution */
    2157           0 :     avio_rb32(pb); /* vert resolution */
    2158           0 :     avio_rb32(pb); /* data size, always 0 */
    2159           0 :     avio_rb16(pb); /* frames per samples */
    2160             : 
    2161           0 :     len = avio_r8(pb); /* codec name, pascal string */
    2162           0 :     if (len > 31)

    2164           0 :     mov_read_mac_string(c, pb, len, codec_name, sizeof(codec_name));
    2165           0 :     if (len < 31)

    2167             :

    2172           0 :     if (!strncmp(codec_name, "Planar Y'CbCr 8-bit 4:2:0", 25)) {

    2174           0 :         st->codecpar->width &= ~1;
    2175           0 :         st->codecpar->height &= ~1;
    2176             :     }

    2179           0 :         !strncmp(codec_name, "Sorenson H263", 13))

    2181             :

    2188           0 :         sc->has_palette = 1;

    2192           0 : static void mov_parse_stsd_audio(MOVContext *c, AVIOContext *pb,
    2193             :                                  AVStream *st, MOVStreamContext *sc)
    2194             : {
    2195           0 :     int bits_per_sample, flags;
    2196           0 :     uint16_t version = avio_rb16(pb);
    2197           0 :     uint32_t id = 0;
    2198           0 :     AVDictionaryEntry *compatible_brands = av_dict_get(c->fc->metadata, "compatible_brands", NULL, AV_DICT_MATCH_CASE);
    2199           0 :     int channel_count;
    2200             : 
    2201           0 :     avio_rb16(pb); /* revision level */
    2202           0 :     id = avio_rl32(pb); /* vendor */
    2203           0 :     av_dict_set(&st->metadata, "vendor_id", av_fourcc2str(id), 0);
    2204             :

    2309           0 : static void mov_parse_stsd_subtitle(MOVContext *c, AVIOContext *pb,

    2314             :     // color, fonts, and default styles, so fake an atom to read it
    2315           0 :     MOVAtom fake_atom = { .size = size };

    2323           0 : static uint32_t yuv_to_rgba(uint32_t ycbcr)
    2324             : {
    2325           0 :     uint8_t r, g, b;
    2326           0 :     int y, cb, cr;
    2327             : 
    2328           0 :     y  = (ycbcr >> 16) & 0xFF;
    2329           0 :     cr = (ycbcr >> 8)  & 0xFF;
    2330           0 :     cb =  ycbcr        & 0xFF;
    2331             : 
    2332           0 :     b = av_clip_uint8((1164 * (y - 16)                     + 2018 * (cb - 128)) / 1000);
    2333           0 :     g = av_clip_uint8((1164 * (y - 16) -  813 * (cr - 128) -  391 * (cb - 128)) / 1000);
    2334           0 :     r = av_clip_uint8((1164 * (y - 16) + 1596 * (cr - 128)                    ) / 1000);
    2335             : 
    2336           0 :     return (r << 16) | (g << 8) | b;
    2337             : }

    2511           0 : static int mov_skip_multiple_stsd(MOVContext *c, AVIOContext *pb,

    2537           0 : int ff_mov_read_stsd_entries(MOVContext *c, AVIOContext *pb, int entries)
    2538             : {
    2539           0 :     AVStream *st;
    2540           0 :     MOVStreamContext *sc;
    2541           0 :     int pseudo_stream_id;
    2542             : 
    2543           0 :     av_assert0 (c->fc->nb_streams >= 1);
    2544           0 :     st = c->fc->streams[c->fc->nb_streams-1];
    2545           0 :     sc = st->priv_data;
    2546             : 
    2547           0 :     for (pseudo_stream_id = 0;
    2548           0 :          pseudo_stream_id < entries && !pb->eof_reached;
    2549           0 :          pseudo_stream_id++) {
    2550             :         //Parsing Sample description table
    2551           0 :         enum AVCodecID id;
    2552           0 :         int ret, dref_id = 1;
    2553           0 :         MOVAtom a = { AV_RL32("stsd") };
    2554           0 :         int64_t start_pos = avio_tell(pb);
    2555           0 :         int64_t size    = avio_rb32(pb); /* size */
    2556           0 :         uint32_t format = avio_rl32(pb); /* data format */
    2557             : 
    2558           0 :         if (size >= 16) {
    2559           0 :             avio_rb32(pb); /* reserved */
    2560           0 :             avio_rb16(pb); /* reserved */
    2561           0 :             dref_id = avio_rb16(pb);
    2562           0 :         } else if (size <= 7) {
    2563           0 :             av_log(c->fc, AV_LOG_ERROR,
    2564             :                    "invalid size %"PRId64" in stsd\n", size);
    2565           0 :             return AVERROR_INVALIDDATA;
    2566             :         }
    2567             : 
    2568           0 :         if (mov_skip_multiple_stsd(c, pb, st->codecpar->codec_tag, format,
    2569           0 :                                    size - (avio_tell(pb) - start_pos))) {
    2570           0 :             sc->stsd_count++;
    2571           0 :             continue;
    2572             :         }
    2573             : 
    2574           0 :         sc->pseudo_stream_id = st->codecpar->codec_tag ? -1 : pseudo_stream_id;
    2575           0 :         sc->dref_id= dref_id;
    2576           0 :         sc->format = format;
    2577             : 
    2578           0 :         id = mov_codec_id(st, format);
    2579             : 
    2580           0 :         av_log(c->fc, AV_LOG_TRACE,
    2581             :                "size=%"PRId64" 4CC=%s codec_type=%d\n", size,
    2582           0 :                av_fourcc2str(format), st->codecpar->codec_type);
    2583             : 
    2584           0 :         st->codecpar->codec_id = id;
    2585           0 :         if (st->codecpar->codec_type==AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO) {
    2586           0 :             mov_parse_stsd_video(c, pb, st, sc);
    2587           0 :         } else if (st->codecpar->codec_type==AVMEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO) {
    2588           0 :             mov_parse_stsd_audio(c, pb, st, sc);
    2589           0 :             if (st->codecpar->sample_rate < 0) {
    2590           0 :                 av_log(c->fc, AV_LOG_ERROR, "Invalid sample rate %d\n", st->codecpar->sample_rate);
    2591           0 :                 return AVERROR_INVALIDDATA;
    2592             :             }
    2593           0 :             if (st->codecpar->ch_layout.nb_channels < 0) {
    2594           0 :                 av_log(c->fc, AV_LOG_ERROR, "Invalid channels %d\n", st->codecpar->ch_layout.nb_channels);
    2595           0 :                 return AVERROR_INVALIDDATA;
    2596             :             }
    2597           0 :         } else if (st->codecpar->codec_type==AVMEDIA_TYPE_SUBTITLE){
    2598           0 :             mov_parse_stsd_subtitle(c, pb, st, sc,
    2599           0 :                                     size - (avio_tell(pb) - start_pos));
    2600             :         } else {
    2601           0 :             ret = mov_parse_stsd_data(c, pb, st, sc,
    2602           0 :                                       size - (avio_tell(pb) - start_pos));
    2603           0 :             if (ret < 0)
    2604           0 :                 return ret;
    2605             :         }
    2606             :         /* this will read extra atoms at the end (wave, alac, damr, avcC, hvcC, SMI ...) */

    2969           0 : static int mov_read_stts(MOVContext *c, AVIOContext *pb, MOVAtom atom)

    2980             :         return 0;
    2981           0 :     st = c->fc->streams[c->fc->nb_streams-1];

    2997             :

    3001           0 :         unsigned int min_entries = FFMIN(FFMAX(i + 1, 1024 * 1024), entries);

    3003             :                                              min_entries * sizeof(*sc->stts_data));

    3008             :         }

    3010           0 :         sc->stts_data = stts_data;

    3013           0 :         sample_duration = avio_rb32(pb);
    3014             : 
    3015           0 :         sc->stts_data[i].count= sample_count;
    3016           0 :         sc->stts_data[i].duration= sample_duration;
    3017             : 
    3018           0 :         av_log(c->fc, AV_LOG_TRACE, "sample_count=%u, sample_duration=%u\n",
    3019             :                 sample_count, sample_duration);
    3020             : 
    3021             :         /* STTS sample offsets are uint32 but some files store it as int32
    3022             :          * with negative values used to correct DTS delays.
    3023             :            There may be abnormally large values as well. */
    3024           0 :         if (sample_duration > c->max_stts_delta) {
    3025             :             // assume high delta is a correction if negative when cast as int32
    3026           0 :             int32_t delta_magnitude = (int32_t)sample_duration;
    3027           0 :             av_log(c->fc, AV_LOG_WARNING, "Too large sample offset %u in stts entry %u with count %u in st:%d. Clipping to 1.\n",
    3028             :                    sample_duration, i, sample_count, st->index);
    3029           0 :             sc->stts_data[i].duration = 1;
    3030           0 :             corrected_dts += (delta_magnitude < 0 ? (int64_t)delta_magnitude : 1) * sample_count;
    3031             :         } else {
    3032           0 :             corrected_dts += sample_duration * sample_count;
    3033             :         }
    3034             : 
    3035           0 :         current_dts += sc->stts_data[i].duration * sample_count;
    3036             : 
    3037           0 :         if (current_dts > corrected_dts) {
    3038           0 :             int64_t drift = (current_dts - corrected_dts)/FFMAX(sample_count, 1);
    3039           0 :             uint32_t correction = (sc->stts_data[i].duration > drift) ? drift : sc->stts_data[i].duration - 1;
    3040           0 :             current_dts -= correction * sample_count;
    3041           0 :             sc->stts_data[i].duration -= correction;
    3042             :         }
    3043             : 
    3044           0 :         duration+=(int64_t)sc->stts_data[i].duration*(uint64_t)sc->stts_data[i].count;
    3045           0 :         total_sample_count+=sc->stts_data[i].count;
    3046             :     }
    3047             : 
    3048           0 :     sc->stts_count = i;
    3049             : 
    3050           0 :     if (duration > 0 &&
    3051           0 :         duration <= INT64_MAX - sc->duration_for_fps &&
    3052           0 :         total_sample_count <= INT_MAX - sc->nb_frames_for_fps) {
    3053           0 :         sc->duration_for_fps  += duration;
    3054           0 :         sc->nb_frames_for_fps += total_sample_count;
    3055             :     }
    3056             :

    3058           0 :         av_log(c->fc, AV_LOG_WARNING, "reached eof, corrupted STTS atom\n");
    3059           0 :         return AVERROR_EOF;
    3060             :     }
    3061             :

    3309             :

    3316             :                                      global_timescale);

    3319             : 
    3320             : /**
    3321             :  * Find the closest previous frame to the timestamp_pts, in e_old index
    3322             :  * entries. Searching for just any frame / just key frames can be controlled by
    3323             :  * last argument 'flag'.
    3324             :  * Note that if ctts_data is not NULL, we will always search for a key frame
    3325             :  * irrespective of the value of 'flag'. If we don't find any keyframe, we will
    3326             :  * return the first frame of the video.
    3327             :  *
    3328             :  * Here the timestamp_pts is considered to be a presentation timestamp and
    3329             :  * the timestamp of index entries are considered to be decoding timestamps.
    3330             :  *
    3331             :  * Returns 0 if successful in finding a frame, else returns -1.
    3332             :  * Places the found index corresponding output arg.
    3333             :  *
    3334             :  * If ctts_old is not NULL, then refines the searched entry by searching
    3335             :  * backwards from the found timestamp, to find the frame with correct PTS.
    3336             :  *
    3337             :  * Places the found ctts_index and ctts_sample in corresponding output args.
    3338             :  */
    3339           0 : static int find_prev_closest_index(AVStream *st,
    3340             :                                    AVIndexEntry *e_old,
    3341             :                                    int nb_old,
    3342             :                                    MOVCtts* ctts_data,
    3343             :                                    int64_t ctts_count,
    3344             :                                    int64_t timestamp_pts,
    3345             :                                    int flag,
    3346             :                                    int64_t* index,
    3347             :                                    int64_t* ctts_index,
    3348             :                                    int64_t* ctts_sample)
    3349             : {
    3350           0 :     MOVStreamContext *msc = st->priv_data;
    3351           0 :     FFStream *const sti = ffstream(st);
    3352           0 :     AVIndexEntry *e_keep = sti->index_entries;
    3353           0 :     int nb_keep = sti->nb_index_entries;
    3354           0 :     int64_t i = 0;
    3355           0 :     int64_t index_ctts_count;
    3356             : 
    3357           0 :     av_assert0(index);
    3358             : 
    3359             :     // If dts_shift > 0, then all the index timestamps will have to be offset by
    3360             :     // at least dts_shift amount to obtain PTS.
    3361             :     // Hence we decrement the searched timestamp_pts by dts_shift to find the closest index element.
    3362           0 :     if (msc->dts_shift > 0) {
    3363           0 :         timestamp_pts -= msc->dts_shift;
    3364             :     }
    3365             : 
    3366           0 :     sti->index_entries    = e_old;
    3367           0 :     sti->nb_index_entries = nb_old;
    3368           0 :     *index = av_index_search_timestamp(st, timestamp_pts, flag | AVSEEK_FLAG_BACKWARD);
    3369             : 
    3370             :     // Keep going backwards in the index entries until the timestamp is the same.
    3371           0 :     if (*index >= 0) {
    3372           0 :         for (i = *index; i > 0 && e_old[i].timestamp == e_old[i - 1].timestamp;
    3373           0 :              i--) {
    3374           0 :             if ((flag & AVSEEK_FLAG_ANY) ||
    3375           0 :                 (e_old[i - 1].flags & AVINDEX_KEYFRAME)) {
    3376           0 :                 *index = i - 1;
    3377             :             }
    3378             :         }
    3379             :     }
    3380             : 
    3381             :     // If we have CTTS then refine the search, by searching backwards over PTS
    3382             :     // computed by adding corresponding CTTS durations to index timestamps.
    3383           0 :     if (ctts_data && *index >= 0) {
    3384           0 :         av_assert0(ctts_index);
    3385           0 :         av_assert0(ctts_sample);
    3386             :         // Find out the ctts_index for the found frame.
    3387           0 :         *ctts_index = 0;
    3388           0 :         *ctts_sample = 0;
    3389           0 :         for (index_ctts_count = 0; index_ctts_count < *index; index_ctts_count++) {
    3390           0 :             if (*ctts_index < ctts_count) {
    3391           0 :                 (*ctts_sample)++;
    3392           0 :                 if (ctts_data[*ctts_index].count == *ctts_sample) {
    3393           0 :                     (*ctts_index)++;
    3394           0 :                     *ctts_sample = 0;
    3395             :                 }
    3396             :             }
    3397             :         }
    3398             : 
    3399           0 :         while (*index >= 0 && (*ctts_index) >= 0 && (*ctts_index) < ctts_count) {
    3400             :             // Find a "key frame" with PTS <= timestamp_pts (So that we can decode B-frames correctly).
    3401             :             // No need to add dts_shift to the timestamp here becase timestamp_pts has already been
    3402             :             // compensated by dts_shift above.
    3403           0 :             if ((e_old[*index].timestamp + ctts_data[*ctts_index].duration) <= timestamp_pts &&
    3404           0 :                 (e_old[*index].flags & AVINDEX_KEYFRAME)) {
    3405             :                 break;
    3406             :             }
    3407             : 
    3408           0 :             (*index)--;
    3409           0 :             if (*ctts_sample == 0) {
    3410           0 :                 (*ctts_index)--;
    3411           0 :                 if (*ctts_index >= 0)
    3412           0 :                   *ctts_sample = ctts_data[*ctts_index].count - 1;
    3413             :             } else {
    3414           0 :                 (*ctts_sample)--;
    3415             :             }
    3416             :         }
    3417             :     }
    3418             : 
    3419             :     /* restore AVStream state*/
    3420           0 :     sti->index_entries    = e_keep;
    3421           0 :     sti->nb_index_entries = nb_keep;
    3422           0 :     return *index >= 0 ? 0 : -1;
    3423             : }
    3424             : 
    3425             : /**
    3426             :  * Add index entry with the given values, to the end of ffstream(st)->index_entries.
    3427             :  * Returns the new size ffstream(st)->index_entries if successful, else returns -1.
    3428             :  *
    3429             :  * This function is similar to ff_add_index_entry in libavformat/utils.c
    3430             :  * except that here we are always unconditionally adding an index entry to
    3431             :  * the end, instead of searching the entries list and skipping the add if
    3432             :  * there is an existing entry with the same timestamp.
    3433             :  * This is needed because the mov_fix_index calls this func with the same
    3434             :  * unincremented timestamp for successive discarded frames.
    3435             :  */
    3436           0 : static int64_t add_index_entry(AVStream *st, int64_t pos, int64_t timestamp,
    3437             :                                int size, int distance, int flags)
    3438             : {
    3439           0 :     FFStream *const sti = ffstream(st);
    3440           0 :     AVIndexEntry *entries, *ie;
    3441           0 :     int64_t index = -1;
    3442           0 :     const size_t min_size_needed = (sti->nb_index_entries + 1) * sizeof(AVIndexEntry);
    3443             : 
    3444             :     // Double the allocation each time, to lower memory fragmentation.
    3445             :     // Another difference from ff_add_index_entry function.
    3446           0 :     const size_t requested_size =
    3447           0 :         min_size_needed > sti->index_entries_allocated_size ?
    3448           0 :         FFMAX(min_size_needed, 2 * sti->index_entries_allocated_size) :
    3449             :         min_size_needed;
    3450             : 
    3451           0 :     if (sti->nb_index_entries + 1U >= UINT_MAX / sizeof(AVIndexEntry))
    3452             :         return -1;
    3453             : 
    3454           0 :     entries = av_fast_realloc(sti->index_entries,
    3455             :                               &sti->index_entries_allocated_size,
    3456             :                               requested_size);
    3457           0 :     if (!entries)
    3458             :         return -1;
    3459             : 
    3460           0 :     sti->index_entries = entries;
    3461             : 
    3462           0 :     index = sti->nb_index_entries++;
    3463           0 :     ie= &entries[index];
    3464             : 
    3465           0 :     ie->pos = pos;
    3466           0 :     ie->timestamp = timestamp;
    3467           0 :     ie->min_distance= distance;
    3468           0 :     ie->size= size;
    3469           0 :     ie->flags = flags;
    3470           0 :     return index;
    3471             : }
    3472             : 
    3473             : /**
    3474             :  * Rewrite timestamps of index entries in the range [end_index - frame_duration_buffer_size, end_index)
    3475             :  * by subtracting end_ts successively by the amounts given in frame_duration_buffer.
    3476             :  */
    3477           0 : static void fix_index_entry_timestamps(AVStream* st, int end_index, int64_t end_ts,
    3478             :                                        int64_t* frame_duration_buffer,
    3479             :                                        int frame_duration_buffer_size) {
    3480           0 :     FFStream *const sti = ffstream(st);
    3481           0 :     int i = 0;
    3482           0 :     av_assert0(end_index >= 0 && end_index <= sti->nb_index_entries);
    3483           0 :     for (i = 0; i < frame_duration_buffer_size; i++) {
    3484           0 :         end_ts -= frame_duration_buffer[frame_duration_buffer_size - 1 - i];
    3485           0 :         sti->index_entries[end_index - 1 - i].timestamp = end_ts;
    3486             :     }
    3487           0 : }
    3488             : 
    3489             : /**
    3490             :  * Append a new ctts entry to ctts_data.
    3491             :  * Returns the new ctts_count if successful, else returns -1.
    3492             :  */
    3493           0 : static int64_t add_ctts_entry(MOVCtts** ctts_data, unsigned int* ctts_count, unsigned int* allocated_size,
    3494             :                               int count, int duration)
    3495             : {
    3496           0 :     MOVCtts *ctts_buf_new;
    3497           0 :     const size_t min_size_needed = (*ctts_count + 1) * sizeof(MOVCtts);
    3498           0 :     const size_t requested_size =
    3499           0 :         min_size_needed > *allocated_size ?
    3500           0 :         FFMAX(min_size_needed, 2 * (*allocated_size)) :
    3501             :         min_size_needed;
    3502             : 
    3503           0 :     if ((unsigned)(*ctts_count) >= UINT_MAX / sizeof(MOVCtts) - 1)
    3504             :         return -1;
    3505             : 
    3506           0 :     ctts_buf_new = av_fast_realloc(*ctts_data, allocated_size, requested_size);
    3507             : 
    3508           0 :     if (!ctts_buf_new)
    3509             :         return -1;
    3510             : 
    3511           0 :     *ctts_data = ctts_buf_new;
    3512             : 
    3513           0 :     ctts_buf_new[*ctts_count].count = count;
    3514           0 :     ctts_buf_new[*ctts_count].duration = duration;
    3515             : 
    3516           0 :     *ctts_count = (*ctts_count) + 1;
    3517           0 :     return *ctts_count;
    3518             : }
    3519             : 
    3520             : #define MAX_REORDER_DELAY 16
    3521           0 : static void mov_estimate_video_delay(MOVContext *c, AVStream* st)
    3522             : {
    3523           0 :     MOVStreamContext *msc = st->priv_data;
    3524           0 :     FFStream *const sti = ffstream(st);
    3525           0 :     int ctts_ind = 0;
    3526           0 :     int ctts_sample = 0;
    3527           0 :     int64_t pts_buf[MAX_REORDER_DELAY + 1]; // Circular buffer to sort pts.
    3528           0 :     int buf_start = 0;
    3529           0 :     int j, r, num_swaps;
    3530             : 
    3531           0 :     for (j = 0; j < MAX_REORDER_DELAY + 1; j++)
    3532           0 :         pts_buf[j] = INT64_MIN;
    3533             : 
    3534           0 :     if (st->codecpar->video_delay <= 0 && msc->ctts_data &&
    3535           0 :         st->codecpar->codec_id == AV_CODEC_ID_H264) {
    3536           0 :         st->codecpar->video_delay = 0;
    3537           0 :         for (int ind = 0; ind < sti->nb_index_entries && ctts_ind < msc->ctts_count; ++ind) {
    3538             :             // Point j to the last elem of the buffer and insert the current pts there.
    3539           0 :             j = buf_start;
    3540           0 :             buf_start = (buf_start + 1);
    3541           0 :             if (buf_start == MAX_REORDER_DELAY + 1)
    3542           0 :                 buf_start = 0;
    3543             : 
    3544           0 :             pts_buf[j] = sti->index_entries[ind].timestamp + msc->ctts_data[ctts_ind].duration;
    3545             : 
    3546             :             // The timestamps that are already in the sorted buffer, and are greater than the
    3547             :             // current pts, are exactly the timestamps that need to be buffered to output PTS
    3548             :             // in correct sorted order.
    3549             :             // Hence the video delay (which is the buffer size used to sort DTS and output PTS),
    3550             :             // can be computed as the maximum no. of swaps any particular timestamp needs to
    3551             :             // go through, to keep this buffer in sorted order.
    3552           0 :             num_swaps = 0;
    3553           0 :             while (j != buf_start) {
    3554           0 :                 r = j - 1;
    3555           0 :                 if (r < 0) r = MAX_REORDER_DELAY;
    3556           0 :                 if (pts_buf[j] < pts_buf[r]) {
    3557           0 :                     FFSWAP(int64_t, pts_buf[j], pts_buf[r]);
    3558           0 :                     ++num_swaps;
    3559             :                 } else {
    3560             :                     break;
    3561             :                 }
    3562           0 :                 j = r;
    3563             :             }
    3564           0 :             st->codecpar->video_delay = FFMAX(st->codecpar->video_delay, num_swaps);
    3565             : 
    3566           0 :             ctts_sample++;
    3567           0 :             if (ctts_sample == msc->ctts_data[ctts_ind].count) {
    3568           0 :                 ctts_ind++;
    3569           0 :                 ctts_sample = 0;
    3570             :             }
    3571             :         }
    3572           0 :         av_log(c->fc, AV_LOG_DEBUG, "Setting codecpar->delay to %d for stream st: %d\n",
    3573             :                st->codecpar->video_delay, st->index);
    3574             :     }
    3575           0 : }
    3576             : 
    3577           0 : static void mov_current_sample_inc(MOVStreamContext *sc)
    3578             : {
    3579           0 :     sc->current_sample++;
    3580           0 :     sc->current_index++;
    3581           0 :     if (sc->index_ranges &&
    3582           0 :         sc->current_index >= sc->current_index_range->end &&
    3583             :         sc->current_index_range->end) {
    3584           0 :         sc->current_index_range++;
    3585           0 :         sc->current_index = sc->current_index_range->start;
    3586             :     }
    3587             : }
    3588             : 
    3589           0 : static void mov_current_sample_dec(MOVStreamContext *sc)
    3590             : {
    3591           0 :     sc->current_sample--;
    3592           0 :     sc->current_index--;
    3593           0 :     if (sc->index_ranges &&
    3594           0 :         sc->current_index < sc->current_index_range->start &&
    3595             :         sc->current_index_range > sc->index_ranges) {
    3596           0 :         sc->current_index_range--;
    3597           0 :         sc->current_index = sc->current_index_range->end - 1;
    3598             :     }
    3599             : }
    3600             : 
    3601           0 : static void mov_current_sample_set(MOVStreamContext *sc, int current_sample)
    3602             : {
    3603           0 :     int64_t range_size;
    3604             : 
    3605           0 :     sc->current_sample = current_sample;
    3606           0 :     sc->current_index = current_sample;
    3607           0 :     if (!sc->index_ranges) {
    3608             :         return;
    3609             :     }
    3610             : 
    3611           0 :     for (sc->current_index_range = sc->index_ranges;
    3612           0 :         sc->current_index_range->end;
    3613           0 :         sc->current_index_range++) {
    3614           0 :         range_size = sc->current_index_range->end - sc->current_index_range->start;
    3615           0 :         if (range_size > current_sample) {
    3616           0 :             sc->current_index = sc->current_index_range->start + current_sample;
    3617           0 :             break;
    3618             :         }
    3619           0 :         current_sample -= range_size;
    3620             :     }
    3621             : }
    3622             : 
    3623             : /**

    3626             :  * Also fixes the timestamps of the index entries to match the timeline
    3627             :  * specified the edit lists.

    3630             : {
    3631           0 :     MOVStreamContext *msc = st->priv_data;

    3666             :     }

    3690           0 :     msc->min_corrected_pts = -1;

    3713           0 :         found_non_empty_edit = 1;

    3724           0 :             if (first_non_zero_audio_edit > 0)
    3725           0 :                 sti->skip_samples = msc->start_pad = 0;
    3726             :         }
    3727             : 
    3728             :         // While reordering frame index according to edit list we must handle properly
    3729             :         // the scenario when edit list entry starts from none key frame.
    3730             :         // We find closest previous key frame and preserve it and consequent frames in index.
    3731             :         // All frames which are outside edit list entry time boundaries will be dropped after decoding.
    3732           0 :         search_timestamp = edit_list_media_time;
    3733           0 :         if (st->codecpar->codec_type == AVMEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO) {
    3734             :             // Audio decoders like AAC need need a decoder delay samples previous to the current sample,

    3736             :             // edit_list_media_time to cover the decoder delay.
    3737           0 :             search_timestamp = FFMAX(search_timestamp - msc->time_scale, e_old[0].timestamp);

    3891             :                                    ctts_data_old[ctts_index_old].duration);

    3893             :                         }
    3894             :                     }
    3895             :                 }
    3896             :                 break;
    3897             :             }
    3898             :         }
    3899             :     }
    3900             :     // If there are empty edits, then msc->min_corrected_pts might be positive
    3901             :     // intentionally. So we subtract the sum duration of emtpy edits here.
    3902           0 :     msc->min_corrected_pts -= empty_edits_sum_duration;
    3903             : 
    3904             :     // If the minimum pts turns out to be greater than zero after fixing the index, then we subtract the
    3905             :     // dts by that amount to make the first pts zero.

    4720             : }
    4721             : 
    4722             : // return 1 when matrix is identity, 0 otherwise
    4723             : #define IS_MATRIX_IDENT(matrix)            \
    4724             :     ( (matrix)[0][0] == (1 << 16) &&       \
    4725             :       (matrix)[1][1] == (1 << 16) &&       \
    4726             :       (matrix)[2][2] == (1 << 30) &&       \
    4727             :      !(matrix)[0][1] && !(matrix)[0][2] && \
    4728             :      !(matrix)[1][0] && !(matrix)[1][2] && \

    4731           0 : static int mov_read_tkhd(MOVContext *c, AVIOContext *pb, MOVAtom atom)
    4732             : {
    4733           0 :     int i, j, e;
    4734           0 :     int width;
    4735           0 :     int height;
    4736           0 :     int display_matrix[3][3];
    4737           0 :     int res_display_matrix[3][3] = { { 0 } };
    4738           0 :     AVStream *st;
    4739           0 :     MOVStreamContext *sc;
    4740           0 :     int version;
    4741           0 :     int flags;
    4742             : 
    4743           0 :     if (c->fc->nb_streams < 1)
    4744             :         return 0;
    4745           0 :     st = c->fc->streams[c->fc->nb_streams-1];
    4746           0 :     sc = st->priv_data;
    4747             : 
    4748             :     // Each stream (trak) should have exactly 1 tkhd. This catches bad files and
    4749             :     // avoids corrupting AVStreams mapped to an earlier tkhd.
    4750           0 :     if (st->id != -1)
    4751             :         return AVERROR_INVALIDDATA;
    4752             : 
    4753           0 :     version = avio_r8(pb);
    4754           0 :     flags = avio_rb24(pb);
    4755           0 :     st->disposition |= (flags & MOV_TKHD_FLAG_ENABLED) ? AV_DISPOSITION_DEFAULT : 0;
    4756             : 
    4757           0 :     if (version == 1) {
    4758           0 :         avio_rb64(pb);
    4759           0 :         avio_rb64(pb);
    4760             :     } else {
    4761           0 :         avio_rb32(pb); /* creation time */
    4762           0 :         avio_rb32(pb); /* modification time */
    4763             :     }
    4764           0 :     st->id = (int)avio_rb32(pb); /* track id (NOT 0 !)*/

    4766             : 
    4767             :     /* highlevel (considering edits) duration in movie timebase */
    4768           0 :     (version == 1) ? avio_rb64(pb) : avio_rb32(pb);
    4769           0 :     avio_rb32(pb); /* reserved */
    4770           0 :     avio_rb32(pb); /* reserved */
    4771             : 
    4772           0 :     avio_rb16(pb); /* layer */
    4773           0 :     avio_rb16(pb); /* alternate group */
    4774           0 :     avio_rb16(pb); /* volume */
    4775           0 :     avio_rb16(pb); /* reserved */
    4776             : 
    4777             :     //read in the display matrix (outlined in ISO 14496-12, Section 6.2.2)
    4778             :     // they're kept in fixed point format through all calculations
    4779             :     // save u,v,z to store the whole matrix in the AV_PKT_DATA_DISPLAYMATRIX
    4780             :     // side data, but the scale factor is not needed to calculate aspect ratio
    4781           0 :     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
    4782           0 :         display_matrix[i][0] = avio_rb32(pb);   // 16.16 fixed point
    4783           0 :         display_matrix[i][1] = avio_rb32(pb);   // 16.16 fixed point
    4784           0 :         display_matrix[i][2] = avio_rb32(pb);   //  2.30 fixed point
    4785             :     }
    4786             : 
    4787           0 :     width = avio_rb32(pb);       // 16.16 fixed point track width
    4788           0 :     height = avio_rb32(pb);      // 16.16 fixed point track height
    4789           0 :     sc->width = width >> 16;
    4790           0 :     sc->height = height >> 16;
    4791             : 
    4792             :     // apply the moov display matrix (after the tkhd one)
    4793           0 :     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
    4794           0 :         const int sh[3] = { 16, 16, 30 };
    4795           0 :         for (j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
    4796           0 :             for (e = 0; e < 3; e++) {
    4797           0 :                 res_display_matrix[i][j] +=
    4798           0 :                     ((int64_t) display_matrix[i][e] *
    4799           0 :                      c->movie_display_matrix[e][j]) >> sh[e];
    4800             :             }
    4801             :         }
    4802             :     }
    4803             : 
    4804             :     // save the matrix when it is not the default identity
    4805           0 :     if (!IS_MATRIX_IDENT(res_display_matrix)) {
    4806           0 :         av_freep(&sc->display_matrix);
    4807           0 :         sc->display_matrix = av_malloc(sizeof(int32_t) * 9);
    4808           0 :         if (!sc->display_matrix)
    4809             :             return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
    4810             : 
    4811           0 :         for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
    4812           0 :             for (j = 0; j < 3; j++)
    4813           0 :                 sc->display_matrix[i * 3 + j] = res_display_matrix[i][j];
    4814             :     }
    4815             : 
    4816             :     // transform the display width/height according to the matrix
    4817             :     // to keep the same scale, use [width height 1<<16]
    4818           0 :     if (width && height && sc->display_matrix) {
    4819             :         double disp_transform[2];
    4820             : 
    4821           0 :         for (i = 0; i < 2; i++)
    4822           0 :             disp_transform[i] = hypot(sc->display_matrix[0 + i],
    4823           0 :                                       sc->display_matrix[3 + i]);
    4824             : 
    4825           0 :         if (disp_transform[0] > 1       && disp_transform[1] > 1 &&
    4826           0 :             disp_transform[0] < (1<<24) && disp_transform[1] < (1<<24) &&
    4827           0 :             fabs((disp_transform[0] / disp_transform[1]) - 1.0) > 0.01)
    4828           0 :             st->sample_aspect_ratio = av_d2q(
    4829             :                 disp_transform[0] / disp_transform[1],
    4830             :                 INT_MAX);
    4831             :     }
    4832             :     return 0;
    4833             : }

    5175             :                                   MOV_FRAG_SAMPLE_FLAG_DEPENDS_YES));
    5176           0 :         if (keyframe) {
    5177           0 :             distance = 0;
    5178           0 :             index_entry_flags |= AVINDEX_KEYFRAME;
    5179             :         }
    5180             :         // Fragments can overlap in time.  Discard overlapping frames after
    5181             :         // decoding.

    5269           0 : static int mov_read_sidx(MOVContext *c, AVIOContext *pb, MOVAtom atom)
    5270             : {
    5271           0 :     int64_t stream_size = avio_size(pb);

    5559           0 : static int mov_read_vpcc(MOVContext *c, AVIOContext *pb, MOVAtom atom)

    5937           0 : static int mov_parse_uuid_spherical(MOVStreamContext *sc, AVIOContext *pb, size_t len)
    5938             : {
    5939           0 :     int ret = 0;
    5940           0 :     uint8_t *buffer = av_malloc(len + 1);
    5941           0 :     const char *val;
    5942             : 
    5943           0 :     if (!buffer)
    5944             :         return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
    5945           0 :     buffer[len] = '\0';
    5946             : 
    5947           0 :     ret = ffio_read_size(pb, buffer, len);
    5948           0 :     if (ret < 0)
    5949           0 :         goto out;
    5950             : 
    5951             :     /* Check for mandatory keys and values, try to support XML as best-effort */
    5952           0 :     if (!sc->spherical &&
    5953           0 :         av_stristr(buffer, "<GSpherical:StitchingSoftware>") &&
    5954           0 :         (val = av_stristr(buffer, "<GSpherical:Spherical>")) &&
    5955           0 :         av_stristr(val, "true") &&
    5956           0 :         (val = av_stristr(buffer, "<GSpherical:Stitched>")) &&
    5957           0 :         av_stristr(val, "true") &&
    5958           0 :         (val = av_stristr(buffer, "<GSpherical:ProjectionType>")) &&
    5959           0 :         av_stristr(val, "equirectangular")) {
    5960           0 :         sc->spherical = av_spherical_alloc(&sc->spherical_size);
    5961           0 :         if (!sc->spherical)
    5962           0 :             goto out;
    5963             : 
    5964           0 :         sc->spherical->projection = AV_SPHERICAL_EQUIRECTANGULAR;

    5969           0 :             if (av_stristr(buffer, "left-right"))

    5974           0 :                 mode = AV_STEREO3D_2D;
    5975             :

    5978           0 :                 goto out;
    5979             : 
    5980           0 :             sc->stereo3d->type = mode;
    5981             :         }
    5982             :

    5984           0 :         val = av_stristr(buffer, "<GSpherical:InitialViewHeadingDegrees>");

    6168             : /**

    6392             : 
    6393             : /**
    6394             :  * Tries to read the given number of bytes from the stream and puts it in a
    6395             :  * newly allocated buffer.  This reads in small chunks to avoid allocating large
    6396             :  * memory if the file contains an invalid/malicious size value.
    6397             :  */
    6398           0 : static int mov_try_read_block(AVIOContext *pb, size_t size, uint8_t **data)
    6399             : {
    6400           0 :     const unsigned int block_size = 1024 * 1024;
    6401           0 :     uint8_t *buffer = NULL;
    6402           0 :     unsigned int alloc_size = 0, offset = 0;
    6403           0 :     while (offset < size) {
    6404           0 :         unsigned int new_size =
    6405           0 :             alloc_size >= INT_MAX - block_size ? INT_MAX : alloc_size + block_size;
    6406           0 :         uint8_t *new_buffer = av_fast_realloc(buffer, &alloc_size, new_size);
    6407           0 :         unsigned int to_read = FFMIN(size, alloc_size) - offset;
    6408           0 :         if (!new_buffer) {
    6409           0 :             av_free(buffer);
    6410           0 :             return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
    6411             :         }
    6412           0 :         buffer = new_buffer;
    6413             : 
    6414           0 :         if (avio_read(pb, buffer + offset, to_read) != to_read) {
    6415           0 :             av_free(buffer);
    6416           0 :             return AVERROR_INVALIDDATA;
    6417             :         }
    6418             :         offset += to_read;
    6419             :     }
    6420             : 
    6421           0 :     *data = buffer;
    6422           0 :     return 0;
    6423             : }

    6955           0 : static int cens_scheme_decrypt(MOVContext *c, MOVStreamContext *sc, AVEncryptionInfo *sample, uint8_t *input, int size)

    6966             :

    6970             :         }
    6971             :     }

    6977             :         /* decrypt the whole packet */
    6978           0 :         av_aes_ctr_crypt(sc->cenc.aes_ctr, input, input, size);
    6979           0 :         return 0;
    6980           0 :     } else if (!sample->crypt_byte_block && !sample->skip_byte_block) {

    6985           0 :     for (i = 0; i < sample->subsample_count; i++) {

    7455           0 : static int rb_size(AVIOContext *pb, uint64_t* value, int size)

    7457           0 :     if (size == 0)

    7704           0 : static int mov_read_default(MOVContext *c, AVIOContext *pb, MOVAtom atom)
    7705             : {
    7706           0 :     int64_t total_size = 0;
    7707           0 :     MOVAtom a;
    7708           0 :     int i;
    7709             : 
    7710           0 :     if (c->atom_depth > 10) {
    7711           0 :         av_log(c->fc, AV_LOG_ERROR, "Atoms too deeply nested\n");
    7712           0 :         return AVERROR_INVALIDDATA;
    7713             :     }
    7714           0 :     c->atom_depth ++;
    7715             : 
    7716           0 :     if (atom.size < 0)
    7717           0 :         atom.size = INT64_MAX;
    7718           0 :     while (total_size <= atom.size - 8) {
    7719           0 :         int (*parse)(MOVContext*, AVIOContext*, MOVAtom) = NULL;
    7720           0 :         a.size = avio_rb32(pb);
    7721           0 :         a.type = avio_rl32(pb);
    7722           0 :         if (avio_feof(pb))
    7723             :             break;
    7724           0 :         if (((a.type == MKTAG('f','r','e','e') && c->moov_retry) ||
    7725           0 :               a.type == MKTAG('h','o','o','v')) &&
    7726           0 :             a.size >= 8 &&
    7727           0 :             c->fc->strict_std_compliance < FF_COMPLIANCE_STRICT) {
    7728           0 :                 uint32_t type;
    7729           0 :                 avio_skip(pb, 4);
    7730           0 :                 type = avio_rl32(pb);
    7731           0 :                 if (avio_feof(pb))
    7732             :                     break;
    7733           0 :                 avio_seek(pb, -8, SEEK_CUR);
    7734           0 :                 if (type == MKTAG('m','v','h','d') ||
    7735           0 :                     type == MKTAG('c','m','o','v')) {
    7736           0 :                     av_log(c->fc, AV_LOG_ERROR, "Detected moov in a free or hoov atom.\n");
    7737           0 :                     a.type = MKTAG('m','o','o','v');
    7738             :                 }
    7739             :         }
    7740           0 :         if (atom.type != MKTAG('r','o','o','t') &&
    7741             :             atom.type != MKTAG('m','o','o','v')) {
    7742           0 :             if (a.type == MKTAG('t','r','a','k') ||
    7743             :                 a.type == MKTAG('m','d','a','t')) {
    7744           0 :                 av_log(c->fc, AV_LOG_ERROR, "Broken file, trak/mdat not at top-level\n");
    7745           0 :                 avio_skip(pb, -8);
    7746           0 :                 c->atom_depth --;
    7747           0 :                 return 0;
    7748             :             }
    7749             :         }
    7750           0 :         total_size += 8;
    7751           0 :         if (a.size == 1 && total_size + 8 <= atom.size) { /* 64 bit extended size */

    7753           0 :             total_size += 8;
    7754             :         }
    7755           0 :         av_log(c->fc, AV_LOG_TRACE, "type:'%s' parent:'%s' sz: %"PRId64" %"PRId64" %"PRId64"\n",

    7757           0 :         if (a.size == 0) {
    7758           0 :             a.size = atom.size - total_size + 8;
    7759             :         }
    7760           0 :         if (a.size < 0)
    7761             :             break;
    7762           0 :         a.size -= 8;
    7763           0 :         if (a.size < 0)
    7764             :             break;
    7765           0 :         a.size = FFMIN(a.size, atom.size - total_size);
    7766             : 
    7767           0 :         for (i = 0; mov_default_parse_table[i].type; i++)
    7768           0 :             if (mov_default_parse_table[i].type == a.type) {
    7769           0 :                 parse = mov_default_parse_table[i].parse;
    7770           0 :                 break;
    7771             :             }
    7772             : 
    7773             :         // container is user data
    7774           0 :         if (!parse && (atom.type == MKTAG('u','d','t','a') ||
    7775             :                        atom.type == MKTAG('i','l','s','t')))
    7776           0 :             parse = mov_read_udta_string;
    7777             : 
    7778             :         // Supports parsing the QuickTime Metadata Keys.
    7779             :         // https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/QuickTime/QTFF/Metadata/Metadata.html
    7780           0 :         if (!parse && c->found_hdlr_mdta &&
    7781           0 :             atom.type == MKTAG('m','e','t','a') &&
    7782           0 :             a.type == MKTAG('k','e','y','s') &&
    7783           0 :             c->meta_keys_count == 0) {
    7784           0 :             parse = mov_read_keys;
    7785             :         }
    7786             : 
    7787           0 :         if (!parse) { /* skip leaf atoms data */
    7788           0 :             avio_skip(pb, a.size);
    7789             :         } else {
    7790           0 :             int64_t start_pos = avio_tell(pb);
    7791           0 :             int64_t left;
    7792           0 :             int err = parse(c, pb, a);
    7793           0 :             if (err < 0) {
    7794           0 :                 c->atom_depth --;
    7795           0 :                 return err;
    7796             :             }
    7797           0 :             if (c->found_moov && c->found_mdat && a.size <= INT64_MAX - start_pos &&
    7798           0 :                 ((!(pb->seekable & AVIO_SEEKABLE_NORMAL) || c->fc->flags & AVFMT_FLAG_IGNIDX || c->frag_index.complete) ||
    7799           0 :                  start_pos + a.size == avio_size(pb))) {
    7800           0 :                 if (!(pb->seekable & AVIO_SEEKABLE_NORMAL) || c->fc->flags & AVFMT_FLAG_IGNIDX || c->frag_index.complete)
    7801           0 :                     c->next_root_atom = start_pos + a.size;
    7802           0 :                 c->atom_depth --;
    7803           0 :                 return 0;
    7804             :             }
    7805           0 :             left = a.size - avio_tell(pb) + start_pos;
    7806           0 :             if (left > 0) /* skip garbage at atom end */
    7807           0 :                 avio_skip(pb, left);
    7808           0 :             else if (left < 0) {
    7809           0 :                 av_log(c->fc, AV_LOG_WARNING,
    7810             :                        "overread end of atom '%s' by %"PRId64" bytes\n",
    7811           0 :                        av_fourcc2str(a.type), -left);
    7812           0 :                 avio_seek(pb, left, SEEK_CUR);
    7813             :             }
    7814             :         }
    7815             : 
    7816           0 :         total_size += a.size;
    7817             :     }
    7818             : 
    7819           0 :     if (total_size < atom.size && atom.size < 0x7ffff)
    7820           0 :         avio_skip(pb, atom.size - total_size);
    7821             : 
    7822           0 :     c->atom_depth --;
    7823           0 :     return 0;
    7824             : }
    7825             : 
    7826           2 : static int mov_probe(const AVProbeData *p)
    7827             : {
    7828           2 :     int64_t offset;
    7829           2 :     uint32_t tag;
    7830           2 :     int score = 0;
    7831           2 :     int moov_offset = -1;
    7832             : 
    7833             :     /* check file header */
    7834           2 :     offset = 0;
    7835           4 :     for (;;) {
    7836           4 :         int64_t size;
    7837           4 :         int minsize = 8;
    7838             :         /* ignore invalid offset */
    7839           4 :         if ((offset + 8ULL) > (unsigned int)p->buf_size)
    7840             :             break;
    7841           2 :         size = AV_RB32(p->buf + offset);
    7842           2 :         if (size == 1 && offset + 16 <= (unsigned int)p->buf_size) {
    7843           0 :             size = AV_RB64(p->buf+offset + 8);
    7844           0 :             minsize = 16;
    7845           2 :         } else if (size == 0) {
    7846           0 :             size = p->buf_size - offset;
    7847             :         }
    7848           2 :         if (size < minsize) {
    7849           0 :             offset += 4;
    7850           0 :             continue;
    7851             :         }
    7852           2 :         tag = AV_RL32(p->buf + offset + 4);
    7853           2 :         switch(tag) {
    7854             :         /* check for obvious tags */
    7855           0 :         case MKTAG('m','o','o','v'):
    7856           0 :             moov_offset = offset + 4;
    7857           0 :         case MKTAG('m','d','a','t'):
    7858             :         case MKTAG('p','n','o','t'): /* detect movs with preview pics like ew.mov and april.mov */
    7859             :         case MKTAG('u','d','t','a'): /* Packet Video PVAuthor adds this and a lot of more junk */
    7860             :         case MKTAG('f','t','y','p'):
    7861           0 :             if (tag == MKTAG('f','t','y','p') &&
    7862           0 :                        (   AV_RL32(p->buf + offset + 8) == MKTAG('j','p','2',' ')
    7863           0 :                         || AV_RL32(p->buf + offset + 8) == MKTAG('j','p','x',' ')
    7864           0 :                         || AV_RL32(p->buf + offset + 8) == MKTAG('j','x','l',' ')
    7865             :                     )) {
    7866           0 :                 score = FFMAX(score, 5);
    7867             :             } else {
    7868             :                 score = AVPROBE_SCORE_MAX;
    7869             :             }
    7870             :             break;
    7871             :         /* those are more common words, so rate then a bit less */
    7872           0 :         case MKTAG('e','d','i','w'): /* xdcam files have reverted first tags */
    7873             :         case MKTAG('w','i','d','e'):
    7874             :         case MKTAG('f','r','e','e'):
    7875             :         case MKTAG('j','u','n','k'):
    7876             :         case MKTAG('p','i','c','t'):
    7877           0 :             score  = FFMAX(score, AVPROBE_SCORE_MAX - 5);
    7878           0 :             break;
    7879           0 :         case MKTAG(0x82,0x82,0x7f,0x7d):
    7880             :         case MKTAG('s','k','i','p'):
    7881             :         case MKTAG('u','u','i','d'):
    7882             :         case MKTAG('p','r','f','l'):
    7883             :             /* if we only find those cause probedata is too small at least rate them */
    7884           0 :             score  = FFMAX(score, AVPROBE_SCORE_EXTENSION);
    7885           0 :             break;
    7886             :         }
    7887           2 :         if (size > INT64_MAX - offset)
    7888             :             break;
    7889           2 :         offset += size;
    7890             :     }
    7891           2 :     if (score > AVPROBE_SCORE_MAX - 50 && moov_offset != -1) {
    7892             :         /* moov atom in the header - we should make sure that this is not a
    7893             :          * MOV-packed MPEG-PS */
    7894           0 :         offset = moov_offset;
    7895             : 
    7896           0 :         while (offset < (p->buf_size - 16)) { /* Sufficient space */
    7897             :                /* We found an actual hdlr atom */
    7898           0 :             if (AV_RL32(p->buf + offset     ) == MKTAG('h','d','l','r') &&
    7899           0 :                 AV_RL32(p->buf + offset +  8) == MKTAG('m','h','l','r') &&
    7900           0 :                 AV_RL32(p->buf + offset + 12) == MKTAG('M','P','E','G')) {
    7901           0 :                 av_log(NULL, AV_LOG_WARNING, "Found media data tag MPEG indicating this is a MOV-packed MPEG-PS.\n");
    7902             :                 /* We found a media handler reference atom describing an
    7903             :                  * MPEG-PS-in-MOV, return a
    7904             :                  * low score to force expanding the probe window until
    7905             :                  * mpegps_probe finds what it needs */
    7906           0 :                 return 5;
    7907             :             } else {
    7908             :                 /* Keep looking */
    7909           0 :                 offset += 2;
    7910             :             }
    7911             :         }
    7912             :     }
    7913             : 
    7914             :     return score;
    7915             : }
    7916             : 
    7917             : // must be done after parsing all trak because there's no order requirement
    7918           0 : static void mov_read_chapters(AVFormatContext *s)
    7919             : {
    7920           0 :     MOVContext *mov = s->priv_data;
    7921           0 :     MOVStreamContext *sc;
    7922           0 :     int64_t cur_pos;
    7923           0 :     int i, j;
    7924           0 :     int chapter_track;
    7925             : 
    7926           0 :     for (j = 0; j < mov->nb_chapter_tracks; j++) {
    7927           0 :         AVStream *st = NULL;
    7928           0 :         FFStream *sti = NULL;
    7929           0 :         chapter_track = mov->chapter_tracks[j];
    7930           0 :         for (i = 0; i < s->nb_streams; i++)
    7931           0 :             if (s->streams[i]->id == chapter_track) {
    7932             :                 st = s->streams[i];
    7933             :                 break;
    7934             :             }
    7935           0 :         if (!st) {
    7936           0 :             av_log(s, AV_LOG_ERROR, "Referenced QT chapter track not found\n");
    7937           0 :             continue;
    7938             :         }
    7939           0 :         sti = ffstream(st);
    7940             : 
    7941           0 :         sc = st->priv_data;
    7942           0 :         cur_pos = avio_tell(sc->pb);
    7943             : 
    7944           0 :         if (st->codecpar->codec_type == AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO) {
    7945           0 :             st->disposition |= AV_DISPOSITION_ATTACHED_PIC | AV_DISPOSITION_TIMED_THUMBNAILS;
    7946           0 :             if (sti->nb_index_entries) {
    7947             :                 // Retrieve the first frame, if possible
    7948           0 :                 AVIndexEntry *sample = &sti->index_entries[0];

    7950           0 :                     av_log(s, AV_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to retrieve first frame\n");
    7951           0 :                     goto finish;
    7952             :                 }
    7953             : 
    7954           0 :                 if (ff_add_attached_pic(s, st, sc->pb, NULL, sample->size) < 0)
    7955             :                     goto finish;
    7956             :             }

    7958           0 :             st->codecpar->codec_type = AVMEDIA_TYPE_DATA;

    7966           0 :                 int len, title_len;
    7967             : 
    7968           0 :                 if (end < sample->timestamp) {
    7969           0 :                     av_log(s, AV_LOG_WARNING, "ignoring stream duration which is shorter than chapters\n");
    7970           0 :                     end = AV_NOPTS_VALUE;
    7971             :                 }
    7972             : 
    7973           0 :                 if (avio_seek(sc->pb, sample->pos, SEEK_SET) != sample->pos) {
    7974           0 :                     av_log(s, AV_LOG_ERROR, "Chapter %d not found in file\n", i);
    7975           0 :                     goto finish;
    7976             :                 }
    7977             : 
    7978             :                 // the first two bytes are the length of the title
    7979           0 :                 len = avio_rb16(sc->pb);
    7980           0 :                 if (len > sample->size-2)
    7981           0 :                     continue;
    7982           0 :                 title_len = 2*len + 1;
    7983           0 :                 if (!(title = av_mallocz(title_len)))
    7984           0 :                     goto finish;
    7985             : 
    7986             :                 // The samples could theoretically be in any encoding if there's an encd
    7987             :                 // atom following, but in practice are only utf-8 or utf-16, distinguished
    7988             :                 // instead by the presence of a BOM
    7989           0 :                 if (!len) {
    7990           0 :                     title[0] = 0;
    7991             :                 } else {
    7992           0 :                     ch = avio_rb16(sc->pb);
    7993           0 :                     if (ch == 0xfeff)
    7994           0 :                         avio_get_str16be(sc->pb, len, title, title_len);
    7995           0 :                     else if (ch == 0xfffe)

    7998           0 :                         AV_WB16(title, ch);

    8000           0 :                             title[len] = 0;

    8003             :                     }

    8008             :             }

    8010           0 : finish:

    8029           0 : static int mov_read_rtmd_track(AVFormatContext *s, AVStream *st)
    8030             : {
    8031           0 :     MOVStreamContext *sc = st->priv_data;
    8032           0 :     FFStream *const sti = ffstream(st);
    8033           0 :     char buf[AV_TIMECODE_STR_SIZE];

    8035           0 :     int hh, mm, ss, ff, drop;
    8036             :

    8055           0 : static int mov_read_timecode_track(AVFormatContext *s, AVStream *st)
    8056             : {
    8057           0 :     MOVStreamContext *sc = st->priv_data;
    8058           0 :     FFStream *const sti = ffstream(st);
    8059           0 :     int flags = 0;
    8060           0 :     int64_t cur_pos = avio_tell(sc->pb);
    8061           0 :     int64_t value;
    8062           0 :     AVRational tc_rate = st->avg_frame_rate;
    8063           0 :     int tmcd_nb_frames = sc->tmcd_nb_frames;
    8064           0 :     int rounded_tc_rate;
    8065             : 
    8066           0 :     if (!sti->nb_index_entries)
    8067             :         return -1;
    8068             : 
    8069           0 :     if (!tc_rate.num || !tc_rate.den || !tmcd_nb_frames)
    8070             :         return -1;
    8071             : 
    8072           0 :     avio_seek(sc->pb, sti->index_entries->pos, SEEK_SET);
    8073           0 :     value = avio_rb32(s->pb);
    8074             : 
    8075           0 :     if (sc->tmcd_flags & 0x0001) flags |= AV_TIMECODE_FLAG_DROPFRAME;
    8076           0 :     if (sc->tmcd_flags & 0x0002) flags |= AV_TIMECODE_FLAG_24HOURSMAX;
    8077           0 :     if (sc->tmcd_flags & 0x0004) flags |= AV_TIMECODE_FLAG_ALLOWNEGATIVE;
    8078             : 
    8079             :     /* Assume Counter flag is set to 1 in tmcd track (even though it is likely
    8080             :      * not the case) and thus assume "frame number format" instead of QT one.
    8081             :      * No sample with tmcd track can be found with a QT timecode at the moment,
    8082             :      * despite what the tmcd track "suggests" (Counter flag set to 0 means QT
    8083             :      * format). */
    8084             : 
    8085             :     /* 60 fps content have tmcd_nb_frames set to 30 but tc_rate set to 60, so
    8086             :      * we multiply the frame number with the quotient.
    8087             :      * See tickets #9492, #9710. */
    8088           0 :     rounded_tc_rate = (tc_rate.num + tc_rate.den / 2) / tc_rate.den;
    8089             :     /* Work around files where tmcd_nb_frames is rounded down from frame rate
    8090             :      * instead of up. See ticket #5978. */
    8091           0 :     if (tmcd_nb_frames == tc_rate.num / tc_rate.den &&
    8092           0 :         s->strict_std_compliance < FF_COMPLIANCE_STRICT)
    8093           0 :         tmcd_nb_frames = rounded_tc_rate;
    8094           0 :     value = av_rescale(value, rounded_tc_rate, tmcd_nb_frames);
    8095             : 
    8096           0 :     parse_timecode_in_framenum_format(s, st, value, flags);
    8097             : 
    8098           0 :     avio_seek(sc->pb, cur_pos, SEEK_SET);
    8099           0 :     return 0;
    8100             : }

    8209           0 :             sc->timecode_track == tmcd_id)

    8215             : /* look for a tmcd track not referenced by any video track, and export it globally */

    8234           0 : static int read_tfra(MOVContext *mov, AVIOContext *f)
    8235             : {
    8236           0 :     int version, fieldlength, i, j;
    8237           0 :     int64_t pos = avio_tell(f);
    8238           0 :     uint32_t size = avio_rb32(f);
    8239           0 :     unsigned track_id, item_count;
    8240             : 
    8241           0 :     if (avio_rb32(f) != MKBETAG('t', 'f', 'r', 'a')) {
    8242             :         return 1;
    8243             :     }
    8244           0 :     av_log(mov->fc, AV_LOG_VERBOSE, "found tfra\n");
    8245             : 
    8246           0 :     version = avio_r8(f);
    8247           0 :     avio_rb24(f);
    8248           0 :     track_id = avio_rb32(f);
    8249           0 :     fieldlength = avio_rb32(f);
    8250           0 :     item_count = avio_rb32(f);
    8251           0 :     for (i = 0; i < item_count; i++) {
    8252           0 :         int64_t time, offset;
    8253           0 :         int index;
    8254           0 :         MOVFragmentStreamInfo * frag_stream_info;
    8255             : 
    8256           0 :         if (avio_feof(f)) {
    8257             :             return AVERROR_INVALIDDATA;
    8258             :         }
    8259             : 
    8260           0 :         if (version == 1) {
    8261           0 :             time   = avio_rb64(f);
    8262           0 :             offset = avio_rb64(f);
    8263             :         } else {
    8264           0 :             time   = avio_rb32(f);
    8265           0 :             offset = avio_rb32(f);
    8266             :         }
    8267             : 
    8268             :         // The first sample of each stream in a fragment is always a random
    8269             :         // access sample.  So it's entry in the tfra can be used as the
    8270             :         // initial PTS of the fragment.
    8271           0 :         index = update_frag_index(mov, offset);
    8272           0 :         frag_stream_info = get_frag_stream_info(&mov->frag_index, index, track_id);
    8273           0 :         if (frag_stream_info &&
    8274           0 :             frag_stream_info->first_tfra_pts == AV_NOPTS_VALUE)

    8545           0 : static AVIndexEntry *mov_find_next_sample(AVFormatContext *s, AVStream **st)
    8546             : {
    8547           0 :     AVIndexEntry *sample = NULL;

    8580           0 : static int mov_switch_root(AVFormatContext *s, int64_t target, int index)

    8639           0 : static int get_eia608_packet(AVIOContext *pb, AVPacket *pkt, int size)
    8640             : {
    8641           0 :     int new_size, ret;
    8642             : 
    8643           0 :     if (size <= 8)
    8644             :         return AVERROR_INVALIDDATA;

    8648             :         return ret;

    8651           0 :     for (int j = 0; j < new_size; j += 3) {

    8654           0 :         pkt->data[j+2] = avio_r8(pb);
    8655             :     }
    8656             : 
    8657             :     return 0;

    8660           0 : static int mov_read_packet(AVFormatContext *s, AVPacket *pkt)
    8661             : {
    8662           0 :     MOVContext *mov = s->priv_data;
    8663           0 :     MOVStreamContext *sc;
    8664           0 :     AVIndexEntry *sample;
    8665           0 :     AVStream *st = NULL;
    8666           0 :     int64_t current_index;
    8667           0 :     int ret;
    8668           0 :     mov->fc = s;
    8669             :  retry:
    8670           0 :     sample = mov_find_next_sample(s, &st);
    8671           0 :     if (!sample || (mov->next_root_atom && sample->pos > mov->next_root_atom)) {
    8672           0 :         if (!mov->next_root_atom)
    8673             :             return AVERROR_EOF;
    8674           0 :         if ((ret = mov_switch_root(s, mov->next_root_atom, -1)) < 0)
    8675           0 :             return ret;
    8676           0 :         goto retry;
    8677             :     }
    8678           0 :     sc = st->priv_data;
    8679             :     /* must be done just before reading, to avoid infinite loop on sample */
    8680           0 :     current_index = sc->current_index;
    8681           0 :     mov_current_sample_inc(sc);
    8682             : 
    8683           0 :     if (mov->next_root_atom) {
    8684           0 :         sample->pos = FFMIN(sample->pos, mov->next_root_atom);
    8685           0 :         sample->size = FFMIN(sample->size, (mov->next_root_atom - sample->pos));
    8686             :     }
    8687             : 
    8688           0 :     if (st->discard != AVDISCARD_ALL) {
    8689           0 :         int64_t ret64 = avio_seek(sc->pb, sample->pos, SEEK_SET);

    8691           0 :             av_log(mov->fc, AV_LOG_ERROR, "stream %d, offset 0x%"PRIx64": partial file\n",
    8692             :                    sc->ffindex, sample->pos);
    8693           0 :             if (should_retry(sc->pb, ret64)) {
    8694           0 :                 mov_current_sample_dec(sc);
    8695           0 :             } else if (ret64 < 0) {
    8696             :                 return (int)ret64;

    8698           0 :             return AVERROR_INVALIDDATA;

    8724           0 :                 return ret;

    8735           0 :                 sc->has_palette = 0;
    8736             :             }
    8737             :         }

    8740           0 :                 ffstream(st)->need_parsing = AVSTREAM_PARSE_FULL;
    8741             :         }
    8742             :     }
    8743             : 
    8744           0 :     pkt->stream_index = sc->ffindex;
    8745           0 :     pkt->dts = sample->timestamp;
    8746           0 :     if (sample->flags & AVINDEX_DISCARD_FRAME) {
    8747           0 :         pkt->flags |= AV_PKT_FLAG_DISCARD;
    8748             :     }

    8806           0 : static int mov_seek_fragment(AVFormatContext *s, AVStream *st, int64_t timestamp)

    8825           0 : static int is_open_key_sample(const MOVStreamContext *sc, int sample)
    8826             : {
    8827             :     // TODO: a bisect search would scale much better
    8828           0 :     for (int i = 0; i < sc->open_key_samples_count; i++) {
    8829           0 :         const int oks = sc->open_key_samples[i];
    8830           0 :         if (oks == sample)
    8831             :             return 1;
    8832           0 :         if (oks > sample) /* list is monotically increasing so we can stop early */
    8833             :             break;
    8834             :     }
    8835             :     return 0;
    8836             : }

    8838             : /*
    8839             :  * Some key sample may be key frames but not IDR frames, so a random access to
    8840             :  * them may not be allowed.
    8841             :  */
    8842           0 : static int can_seek_to_key_sample(AVStream *st, int sample, int64_t requested_pts)
    8843             : {
    8844           0 :     MOVStreamContext *sc = st->priv_data;
    8845           0 :     FFStream *const sti = ffstream(st);

    8847             : 
    8848           0 :     if (st->codecpar->codec_id != AV_CODEC_ID_HEVC)
    8849             :         return 1;
    8850             : 
    8851           0 :     if (sample >= sc->sample_offsets_count)
    8852             :         return 1;

    8854           0 :     key_sample_dts = sti->index_entries[sample].timestamp;
    8855           0 :     key_sample_pts = key_sample_dts + sc->sample_offsets[sample] + sc->dts_shift;
    8856             : 
    8857             :     /*
    8858             :      * If the sample needs to be presented before an open key sample, they may
    8859             :      * not be decodable properly, even though they come after in decoding
    8860             :      * order.
    8861             :      */

    8863           0 :         return 0;
    8864             : 
    8865             :     return 1;

    8868           0 : static int mov_seek_stream(AVFormatContext *s, AVStream *st, int64_t timestamp, int flags)
    8869             : {
    8870           0 :     MOVStreamContext *sc = st->priv_data;
    8871           0 :     FFStream *const sti = ffstream(st);
    8872           0 :     int sample, time_sample, ret;
    8873           0 :     unsigned int i;
    8874             : 
    8875             :     // Here we consider timestamp to be PTS, hence try to offset it so that we
    8876             :     // can search over the DTS timeline.
    8877           0 :     timestamp -= (sc->min_corrected_pts + sc->dts_shift);
    8878             :

    8930           0 : static int64_t mov_get_skip_samples(AVStream *st, int sample)
    8931             : {
    8932           0 :     MOVStreamContext *sc = st->priv_data;
    8933           0 :     FFStream *const sti = ffstream(st);

    8935           0 :     int64_t ts = sti->index_entries[sample].timestamp;
    8936           0 :     int64_t off;
    8937             : 
    8938           0 :     if (st->codecpar->codec_type != AVMEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO)
    8939             :         return 0;
    8940             : 
    8941             :     /* compute skip samples according to stream start_pad, seek ts and first ts */
    8942           0 :     off = av_rescale_q(ts - first_ts, st->time_base,
    8943           0 :                        (AVRational){1, st->codecpar->sample_rate});

    8947           0 : static int mov_read_seek(AVFormatContext *s, int stream_index, int64_t sample_time, int flags)
